intro: Platycarpum maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's flatfruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers and distinctive, flat, clustered fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
